result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan K. GONZALEZ was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Complete HSED/GED.
Maintain full-time employment/schooling combination.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Have no contact with any known drug users or dealers.  

Provide DNA sample.
Court finds that defendant will benefit and society will not be harmed by expungment of record pursuant to Section 973.015 of the Wisconsin Statutes upon successful completion of sentence.

timeConds.notes: imposed and stayed to be imposed upon the agent's discretion.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain full-time employment/schooling at the agent's discretion.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Complete HSED/GED.

Have no contact known drug users or dealers.

Reimburse Manitowoc County $90.00 buy money.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: Transcript of sentencing after revocation held on 04-10-18.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: John Bilka, through Public Defender.
Per Request of State Public Defender's Office
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 10, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant in custody.
The defendant states that he has private counsel representing him on other matters and thought he would be here for this matter also.  
The Court explains to the defendant that if his attorney does not represent him on this matter, then it is his responsibility to contact the public defender and have an attorney appointed through their office.
Scheduling conference is set for 04-03-18 at 2:30 pm.
Notice to defendant.
Minutes.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 20, 2018 at 02:15 pm.
